intro: Aeschynanthus guangxiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi gloxinia, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun. Aeschynanthus guangxiensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering display.
